My Timeline
text.text: A brief overview of my educational and work background

media.caption: Leiden University College, The Hague Class of 2020

text.headline: Bachelor of Science ðŸŽ“
text.text:
Government, Economics and Development

Graduated Cum Laude from Leiden University College (LUC), the Hague.

During my time at LUC I also participated in a 6 month study abroad program in Buenos Aires, Argentina

My favourite classes included South American History and Politics, Environmental Governance and Mathematical Modeling

text.headline: Master of Arts ðŸŽ“
text.text:
Government and Politics, major in Sustainability and Resilience

For my Master's Degree, I moved to the beautiful city of Rome, Italy where I ended up spending three years. During my master's degree I developed a particular interest in International Law and Diplomacy

text.headline: Data Science & AI 9 weeks intensive Bootcamp ðŸŽ“
text.text: Delved into my interest for Data Science, gaining fluency in Python, SQL, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow Keras among many others. Implemented my first ideas into the project Future Proofing Cities.

media.caption: Summer Institue in Computational Social Sciences

text.headline: Summer Institute in Computational Social Sciences
text.text: In the summer of 2023, I participated in a 2 week summer institute with peers all interested in applying Data Science tools to Social Sciences. During these two weeks we focused on topics such as digital trace data, spatial analysis, ethics and AI.

text.headline:
Data Science Teacher
Batch Manager
text.text:
Since February 2023, I have been working as a Data Science and Data Analytics teacher. Having now helped nearly 700 students in their discovery of the world of Data Science.

I have found this role especially fulfilling and have greatly appreciated the opportunity to develop my comminucation skills as well as further develop my own Data Science knowledge.

One aspect I particularly enjoy of this position is Project Weeks. Indeed, at the end of the course, the students work on their projects to put into practice the skills they have seen throughout the bootcamp. Following them during this phase has been incredibly educational for me. I have discovered new sectors of applications of ML and DL techniques as well as enjoyed seeing my students thrive.
